name: Get-Azure-AD-Application
description: Get an Azure AD Application based on ObjectId, ApplicationId or Name
author: Ralph Jansen

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Resource Manager subscription to configure before running PowerShell.

inputs.name: method
inputs.label: Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the method to get an Azure AD Application.

inputs.name: objectId
inputs.label: Object Id
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the Application object Id of the Azure AD Application.

inputs.name: applicationId
inputs.label: Application Id
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the Application Id of the Azure AD Application.

inputs.name: name
inputs.label: Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the Azure AD Application.

inputs.name: failIfNotFound
inputs.label: Fail build if not found
inputs.helpMarkDown: Let the build fail if the Azure AD Application cannot be found.

outputVariables.name: ObjectId
outputVariables.description: The ObjectId of the Azure AD Application

outputVariables.name: ApplicationId
outputVariables.description: The ApplicationId of the Azure AD Application

outputVariables.name: Name
outputVariables.description: The Name of the Azure AD Application

outputVariables.name: AppIdUri
outputVariables.description: The App Id Uri of the Azure AD Application

outputVariables.name: HomePageUrl
outputVariables.description: The Home page URL of the Azure AD Application

outputVariables.name: ServicePrincipalObjectId
outputVariables.description: The ObjectId of the Service Principal connected to the Azure AD Application
